content.question: The height of an object at time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> is given by <math alttext="h of t, equals, t squared, minus the fraction 16 over t, end fraction, plus 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></math>. What is the velocity of the object at time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
